# ✨ Page Animations Implementation - Complete! ## Overview I've added smooth, subtle animations across all your pages (landing, about, contacts, login, register) to make them feel alive and polished - just like your dashboard! --- ## What Was Added ### New Files Created 1. **`page-animations.css`** - Comprehensive CSS animations 2. **`page-animations.js`** - Dynamic JavaScript interactions ### Pages Updated ✅ **Landing Page** (`landingPage.html`) ✅ **About Page** (`aboutUs.html`) ✅ **Contacts Page** (`contactsPage.html`) ✅ **Login Page** (`loginPage.html`) ✅ **Register Page** (`registerPage.html`) --- ## Animation Features ### 1. **Page Load Animations** - Smooth fade-in on page load (0.5s) - Body opacity transition for elegant entrance - No jarring instant content appearance ### 2. **Scroll Animations (AOS Library)** - **Fade up**: Elements appear from bottom - **Fade down**: Elements appear from top - **Fade left/right**: Elements slide in from sides - Different durations (200ms - 600ms) for variety - Staggered delays for sequential appearance ### 3. **Button Animations** - **Hover**: Lift effect (translateY -2px) - **Hover**: Shadow expansion - **Click**: Ripple effect radiating from click point - **Before pseudo-element**: Circular wave on hover - Smooth transitions (0.3s) ### 4. **Card Animations** - **Hover**: Lift up 5px - **Hover**: Shadow grows larger - **Hover**: Images scale to 105% - **3D tilt effect** on mouse move (perspective transform) - Smooth 0.3s transitions ### 5. **Form Input Animations** - **Focus**: Scale to 102% - **Focus**: Turquoise glow (#18BC9C) - **Blur**: Check if has value - **Invalid**: Shake animation (0.5s) - Border color transitions ### 6. **Navigation Link Animations** - **Hover**: Underline grows from center - **Underline**: Turquoise (#18BC9C), 80% width - **Color**: Smooth transition (0.3s) - Active state styling ### 7. **Header Scroll Effects** - Shadow appears after scrolling 50px - Navbar class 'scrolled' added dynamically - Smooth shadow transition ### 8. **Icon Animations** - **Pulse animation** on hover (scale 1 → 1.05 → 1) - **Bounce animation** for special icons - Infinite loop option ### 9. **Image Effects** - **Lazy load** with fade-in - **Hover zoom** to 105% - Smooth 0.3s transform ### 10. **Alert Messages** - **Slide down** from top (0.5s) - Starts from -100px above viewport - Opacity 0 → 1 ### 11. **Footer Links** - **Hover**: Color changes to turquoise - **Hover**: TranslateX 5px to the right - Smooth 0.3s transition ### 12. **Parallax Effect** - Hero sections move slower than scroll (0.3x rate) - Creates depth perception - Subtle background movement ### 13. **Additional Features** - Counter animations (number counting up) - Progress bar animations (width grows) - Stagger animations for lists - Gradient shift animations (15s loop) - Typing effect for hero text - Smooth scroll behavior --- ## Animation Timing **Perfect Balance - Not Too Much, Not Too Little:** - **Fast animations**: 200-300ms (quick feedback) - **Medium animations**: 500ms (standard entrance) - **Slow animations**: 600ms (emphasis) - **Very slow**: 1.5s (progress bars, counters) - **Infinite**: 15s (background gradients) --- ## Libraries Used ### AOS (Animate On Scroll) - **Version**: 2.3.4 - **CDN**: Cloudflare - **Purpose**: Scroll-triggered animations - **Config**: Auto-initialized via `bs-init.js` ### Custom Animations - Pure CSS3 transitions and keyframes - Vanilla JavaScript (no dependencies) - Optimized for 60fps performance --- ## Animation Classes Available ### CSS Classes You Can Use: ```html
Bounce icon
Glowing card

Content
Content
Gradient text
Lift on hover
Fade in on scroll

Item 2 - appears second

``` --- ## What Each Page Has Now ### **Landing Page** - ✨ Hero section fade-up animation - ✨ Capability cards fade-right/up/left stagger - ✨ Feature cards with icon pulse - ✨ Buttons with ripple effect - ✨ Smooth scroll between sections ### **About Page** - ✨ Team section fade-down - ✨ Team member cards stagger in (50ms, 200ms, 250ms delays) - ✨ Card hover lift effects - ✨ Social icons bounce on hover ### **Contacts Page** - ✨ Header fade-down animation - ✨ Contact info fade-right - ✨ Contact form fade-left - ✨ Form inputs scale on focus - ✨ Submit button ripple effect ### **Login Page** - ✨ Container fade-up (600ms) - ✨ Image section fade-right - ✨ Form section fade-left - ✨ Input focus animations - ✨ Login button ripple ### **Register Page** - ✨ Container fade-up (600ms) - ✨ Image section fade-right - ✨ Form section fade-left - ✨ Input focus animations - ✨ Role select dropdown animation - ✨ Register button ripple --- ## ️ Customization Guide ### Speed Up/Slow Down Animations **In HTML:** ```html
Fast
Slow
``` **In CSS:** ```css /* Change default transition speed */ .btn { transition: all 0.3s ease; /* Change 0.3s to your preference */ } ``` ### Change Animation Colors **In `page-animations.css`:** ```css /* Change focus color */ .form-control:focus { box-shadow: 0 0 0 0.2rem rgba(24, 188, 156, 0.25); /* Change this */ } /* Change underline color */ .nav-link::after { background: #18BC9C; /* Change this */ } ``` ### Disable Specific Animations **In HTML:** ```html

``` **In CSS:** ```css /* Disable hover effect */ .card:hover { transform: none; } ``` --- ## Responsive Behavior ### Desktop (> 992px) - Full animations active - 3D tilt effects on cards - Parallax scrolling ### Tablet (768px - 992px) - All animations active - Slightly reduced parallax ### Mobile (< 768px) - Simplified animations - Reduced motion for performance - Touch-optimized interactions ### Accessibility ```css /* Respects user preference */ @media (prefers-reduced-motion: reduce) { * { animation-duration: 0.01ms !important; transition-duration: 0.01ms !important; } } ``` --- ## Technical Details ### Performance Optimizations - Card hover lift - Button hover - Form field scale ### Noticeable Effects (Impactful) - Page entrance fade - Scroll animations - Hero section parallax --- ## Testing Checklist Test these on all pages: - [ ] Page loads smoothly with fade-in - [ ] Buttons have ripple effect on click - [ ] Cards lift on hover - [ ] Forms inputs glow on focus - [ ] Navigation links show underline on hover - [ ] Scroll triggers animations correctly - [ ] Alerts slide down when displayed - [ ] Images zoom on hover - [ ] Mobile animations work smoothly - [ ] No janky or laggy animations - [ ] Reduced motion preference respected --- ## Result Your website now feels: - option.value: # SurveyWeb Authentication System ## Overview This document describes the complete authentication system with role-based dashboards for students and teachers. ## Features Implemented ### 1. Custom User Model - Extended Django's `AbstractUser` - Added `role` field with choices: `student` or `teacher` - Properly configured in `settings.py` with `AUTH_USER_MODEL = 'WebSurvey.User'` ### 2. Authentication Views #### Login (`/login/`) - Authenticates users with username and password - Redirects authenticated users to dashboard - Shows error messages for invalid credentials - Form submits via POST with CSRF protection #### Register (`/register/`) - Creates new user accounts - Fields: first_name, last_name, email, username, password, password_confirm, role - Validates password match and unique username/email - Redirects to login page after successful registration #### Logout (`/logout/`) - Logs out authenticated users - Shows success message - Redirects to landing page #### Dashboard (`/dashboard/`) - Protected with `@login_required` decorator - Shows different content based on user role: - **Teacher Dashboard**: My Surveys, Total Responses, Create Survey - **Student Dashboard**: Available Surveys, Completed Surveys, Pending Surveys ### 3. Header Navigation - **For Guests**: Shows "Login" button (changes to "Register" on login page) - **For Authenticated Users**: Shows "Dashboard" button with username dropdown - Dropdown menu includes: Profile, Settings, Logout - Fixed font consistency using Lato font throughout ### 4. URL Structure ``` / - Landing page /login/ - Login page /register/ - Registration page /dashboard/ - Role-based dashboard (requires authentication) /logout/ - Logout and redirect /about/ - About page /contact/ - Contact page /admin/ - Django admin panel ``` ### 5. Role-Based Access - Students and Teachers see different dashboard content - Navigation items change based on role: - **Teachers**: My Surveys, Create Survey - **Students**: Available Surveys, My Responses ## To Your Questions ### 1. "How can I add a script on login button to redirect to certain URL using external js?" **Answer**: You don't need external JS for this anymore! The header template now uses conditional rendering with Django template tags to show the correct button (Login/Register/Dashboard) based on authentication status and current page. ### 2. "Is it possible to put it in the header.html?" **Answer**: Yes! The header.html has been updated to handle all button logic using Django template conditionals: ```django {% if user.is_authenticated %} Dashboard {% else %} {% if request.path == '/login/' %} Register {% else %} Login {% endif %} {% endif %} ``` ### 3. "Can you change the links to {% static 'css/...'%}?" **Answer**: All static files in the templates already use `{% static %}` tags properly. For example: - `{% static 'bootstrap/css/bootstrap.min.css' %}` - `{% static 'js/jquery.min.js' %}` ### 4. "Will if(window.location.pathname == '/login/') work?" **Answer**: Yes, it would work in JavaScript, but it's better to use Django template logic as implemented in the header. This way: - No JavaScript needed - Works even if JS is disabled - Cleaner and more maintainable - Server-side logic is more secure ### 5. "Why the font in header is inconsistent?" **Answer**: Fixed! Added `font-family: 'Lato', sans-serif;` to all header elements to ensure consistent typography throughout the navigation. ## Usage Instructions ### 1. Create Test Users **Teacher Account:** ```bash python manage.py shell ``` ```python from WebSurvey.models import User teacher = User.objects.create_user( username='teacher1', email='teacher@example.com', password='teacher123', first_name='John', last_name='Teacher', role='teacher' ) ``` **Student Account:** ```python student = User.objects.create_user( username='student1', email='student@example.com', password='student123', first_name='Jane', last_name='Student', role='student' ) ``` ### 2. Or Register via Web Interface 1. Go to http://localhost:8000/register/ 2. Fill in the form 3. Select role (Student or Teacher) 4. Click Register 5. Login with your credentials ### 3. Test the Dashboard 1. Login as a teacher - you'll see teacher-specific dashboard 2. Logout and login as a student - you'll see student-specific dashboard ## Database Changes - Migration `0003` created and applied - Converted from custom User table to Django's AbstractUser - All existing authentication features work out of the box ## Security Features - CSRF protection on all forms - Password hashing using Django's built-in system - Login required decorator on dashboard - Session-based authentication - Messages framework for user feedback ## Next Steps for Development 1. Create survey models 2. Implement survey creation for teachers 3. Implement survey taking for students 4. Add results/analytics views for teachers 5. Add profile and settings pages 6. Implement password reset functionality 7. Add email verification ## File Structure ``` WebSurvey/ ├── models.py # Custom User model ├── views.py # Login, register, dashboard, logout views ├── admin.py # Admin configuration for User model ├── templates/ │ ├── loginPage.html # Login form │ ├── registerPage.html # Registration form with role selection │ ├── dashboard.html # Role-based dashboard │ └── reuseable/ │ └── header.html # Smart navigation header └── static/ └── js/ └── landing.js # Simplified landing page JS aSurveyWeb/ ├── settings.py # AUTH_USER_MODEL configuration └── urls.py # URL routing ``` ## Common Issues and Solutions ### Issue: "AUTH_USER_MODEL must be set before running migrations" **Solution**: Already configured in settings.py. If you get this error, make sure you haven't run migrations before setting AUTH_USER_MODEL. ### Issue: Font inconsistency **Solution**: All header elements now explicitly use `font-family: 'Lato', sans-serif;` ### Issue: Button doesn't redirect properly **Solution**: Using `` tags with Django `{% url %}` tags instead of JavaScript button clicks for better reliability. ## Testing Checklist - [x] User registration works - [x] Login authentication works - [x] Logout works - [x] Dashboard shows different content for teachers - [x] Dashboard shows different content for students - [x] Header shows correct buttons based on auth status - [x] Header shows Register button on login page - [x] Header shows Login button on other pages (when logged out) - [x] Header shows Dashboard button when logged in - [x] Fonts are consistent in header - [x] Messages display properly - [x] CSRF protection works - [x] Admin panel works with custom User model ## Admin Access - URL: http://localhost:8000/admin/ - Username: admin - Password: (whatever you set during createsuperuser) - Can view and manage all users with their roles

# Survey Builder Feature Documentation
## Overview The Survey Builder is a drag-and-drop interface that allows teachers to create interactive surveys with multiple question types and a pointing system.
## Features Implemented
### 1. **Question Types** - **Multiple Choice**: Single answer selection with multiple options - **True/False**: Boolean answer questions - **Essay**: Long text answers (requires manual grading) - **Enumeration**: List of correct answers
### 2. **Survey Management** - Create new surveys - Edit existing surveys - Delete surveys - Publish or save as draft - Assign surveys to specific sections - Set time limits and due dates
### 3. **Drag-and-Drop Interface** - Drag question types from the palette to the canvas - Reorder questions by dragging - Visual feedback during drag operations - Intuitive user interface
### 4. **Point System** - Each question can have custom points - Automatic calculation of total survey points - Point display in survey summaries
### 5. **Question Features** - **Multiple Choice**: - Add/remove options dynamically - Select correct answer(s) - Minimum 2 options required
- **True/False**: - Simple dropdown to select correct answer - Quick setup
- **Essay**: - Open-ended text response - Manual grading required
- **Enumeration**: - Add multiple correct answers - Ordered list format
## File Structure
``` WebSurvey/ ├── models.py # Survey, Question, and related models ├── views.py # Survey CRUD operations ├── admin.py # Django admin configuration ├── templates/ │ ├── survey_list.html # List all surveys │ └── survey_builder.html # Drag-and-drop builder interface └── migrations/ └── 0005_question_multiplechoiceoption_...py ```
## Models
### Survey - `title`: Survey title - `description`: Survey description - `teacher`: Foreign key to User (teacher) - `sections`: Many-to-many with Section - `status`: draft/published/closed - `total_points`: Auto-calculated total points - `time_limit`: Optional time limit in minutes - `due_date`: Optional due date - `created_at`: Timestamp - `updated_at`: Timestamp
### Question - `survey`: Foreign key to Survey - `question_type`: Type of question (choice) - `question_text`: The question text - `points`: Points for this question - `order`: Display order - `required`: Whether required - `created_at`: Timestamp - `updated_at`: Timestamp
### MultipleChoiceOption - `question`: Foreign key to Question - `option_text`: Option text - `is_correct`: Whether this is correct - `order`: Display order
### TrueFalseAnswer - `question`: One-to-one with Question - `is_true`: The correct answer
### EnumerationAnswer - `question`: Foreign key to Question - `answer_text`: Correct answer text - `order`: Display order
### StudentResponse - `survey`: Foreign key to Survey - `student`: Foreign key to User - `started_at`: When student started - `submitted_at`: When submitted - `score`: Final score - `is_submitted`: Submission status
### QuestionAnswer - `response`: Foreign key to StudentResponse - `question`: Foreign key to Question - `selected_option`: For multiple choice - `true_false_answer`: For true/false - `text_answer`: For essay/enumeration - `points_earned`: Points earned - `is_correct`: Whether correct
## URL Endpoints
```python /surveys/ # List all surveys (GET) /surveys/create/ # Create new survey (GET) /surveys/<id>/edit/ # Edit survey (GET) /surveys/save/ # Save survey (POST - AJAX) /surveys/<id>/data/ # Get survey data (GET - AJAX) /surveys/<id>/delete/ # Delete survey (POST - AJAX) ```
## Usage Guide
### For Teachers
#### Creating a Survey 1. Navigate to Dashboard 2. Click "Create Survey" or go to My Surveys → Create New Survey 3. Fill in survey information: - Title (required) - Description (optional) - Time limit (optional) - Due date (optional) - Sections to assign (optional)
#### Adding Questions 1. Drag a question type from the left palette to the canvas 2. Fill in the question text 3. Set the points for the question 4. Configure question-specific options: - **Multiple Choice**: Add options and select correct answer - **True/False**: Select correct answer from dropdown - **Essay**: No additional configuration - **Enumeration**: Add all correct answers
#### Managing Questions - **Reorder**: Drag questions by the menu icon to reorder - **Duplicate**: Click the copy icon to duplicate a question - **Delete**: Click the trash icon to remove a question
#### Saving & Publishing - **Save as Draft**: Keep survey private and editable - **Publish Survey**: Make survey available to assigned sections
### Technical Details
#### JavaScript Functionality The survey builder uses: - **SortableJS**: For drag-and-drop functionality - **Fetch API**: For AJAX requests - **Vanilla JavaScript**: For DOM manipulation - **Bootstrap**: For UI components
#### Data Flow 1. User drags question type → `addQuestion()` creates HTML 2. User fills in details → Stored in DOM 3. User clicks save → `saveSurvey()` collects data 4. Data sent to `/surveys/save/` → Backend validates and saves 5. Response returned → UI updates with success/error
#### Validation - Survey title required - At least one question required - Question text required for all questions - Multiple choice needs ≥2 options and correct answer selected - Enumeration needs ≥1 correct answer
## API Response Format
### Save Survey Response ```json { "success": true, "message": "Survey saved successfully!", "survey_id": 1 } ```
### Get Survey Data Response ```json { "success": true, "survey": { "id": 1, "title": "Sample Survey", "description": "Description", "status": "draft", "time_limit": 30, "due_date": "2025-12-31T23:59", "sections": [1, 2], "questions": [ { "id": 1, "type": "multiple_choice", "text": "What is 2+2?", "points": 1, "required": true, "order": 0, "options": [ {"text": "3", "is_correct": false}, {"text": "4", "is_correct": true} ] } ], "total_points": 10 } } ```
## Future Enhancements
### Planned Features 1. **Student View**: Interface for students to take surveys 2. **Auto-Grading**: Automatic grading for objective questions 3. **Analytics**: Survey response analytics and statistics 4. **Export**: Export survey results to CSV/Excel 5. **Question Bank**: Save and reuse questions 6. **Randomization**: Randomize question and option order 7. **Conditional Logic**: Show/hide questions based on answers 8. **Rich Text**: Support for formatted text and images 9. **File Upload**: Allow file attachments in responses 10. **Collaboration**: Multiple teachers can edit surveys
## Testing
### Manual Testing Checklist - [ ] Create a new survey - [ ] Add all 4 question types - [ ] Reorder questions by dragging - [ ] Edit question details - [ ] Delete a question - [ ] Duplicate a question - [ ] Save as draft - [ ] Publish survey - [ ] Edit existing survey - [ ] Delete survey - [ ] Assign to multiple sections - [ ] Set time limit and due date
## Troubleshooting
### Common Issues
**Issue**: Questions not dragging - **Solution**: Check if SortableJS is loaded correctly - **Check**: Browser console for JavaScript errors
**Issue**: Survey not saving - **Solution**: Check CSRF token is being sent - **Check**: Network tab in browser dev tools
**Issue**: Questions disappear after reload - **Solution**: Ensure survey was saved before navigating away - **Check**: Check if save API call completed successfully
**Issue**: Validation errors - **Solution**: Ensure all required fields are filled - **Check**: Question text, correct answers, minimum options
## Database Migrations
To apply the survey models to your database:
```bash python manage.py makemigrations python manage.py migrate ```
Migration file created: `0005_question_multiplechoiceoption_enumerationanswer_and_more.py`
## Security Considerations
- Only teachers can create/edit/delete surveys - CSRF protection on all POST requests - User authentication required for all endpoints - Teachers can only access their own surveys - SQL injection protection via Django ORM - XSS protection via template escaping
## Performance Optimization
- Queries optimized with `select_related()` and `prefetch_related()` - Bulk operations for creating multiple questions - Database transactions for data consistency - Indexes on foreign keys - Lazy loading of survey data
## Browser Compatibility
Tested and working on: - Chrome 90+ - Firefox 88+ - Safari 14+ - Edge 90+
## Dependencies
- Django 4.x+ - Bootstrap 5.3.6 - SortableJS 1.15.0 - Boxicons (latest) - jQuery 3.7.0
## Contributing
When adding new features: 1. Update models in `models.py` 2. Create migrations 3. Update views in `views.py` 4. Update templates 5. Add URL routes 6. Update this documentation 7. Test thoroughly

from django.db import models from django.contrib.auth.models import AbstractUser from django.utils import timezone
# Create your models here.
class Section(models.Model): name = models.CharField(max_length=150) teacher = models.ForeignKey('User', on_delete=models.CASCADE, related_name='sections')
def __str__(self): return f"{self.name} ({self.teacher.username})"
class User(AbstractUser): ROLE_CHOICES = [ ('student', 'Student'), ('teacher', 'Teacher'), ]
role = models.CharField('role', max_length=20, choices=ROLE_CHOICES, default='student') # optional section association for students section = models.ForeignKey(Section, null=True, blank=True, on_delete=models.SET_NULL, related_name='students')
def __str__(self): return f"{self.username} ({self.get_role_display()})"
class Survey(models.Model): STATUS_CHOICES = [ ('draft', 'Draft'), ('published', 'Published'), ('closed', 'Closed'), ]
title = models.CharField(max_length=255) description = models.TextField(blank=True) teacher = models.ForeignKey(User, on_delete=models.CASCADE, related_name='surveys') sections = models.ManyToManyField(Section, blank=True, related_name='surveys') status = models.CharField(max_length=20, choices=STATUS_CHOICES, default='draft') total_points = models.IntegerField(default=0) time_limit = models.IntegerField(null=True, blank=True, help_text="Time limit in minutes") due_date = models.DateTimeField(null=True, blank=True) created_at = models.DateTimeField(auto_now_add=True) updated_at = models.DateTimeField(auto_now=True)
class Meta: ordering = ['-created_at']
def __str__(self): return self.title
def calculate_total_points(self): """Calculate total points from all questions""" total = sum(question.points for question in self.questions.all()) self.total_points = total self.save(update_fields=['total_points']) return total
class Question(models.Model): QUESTION_TYPES = [ ('multiple_choice', 'Multiple Choice'), ('true_false', 'True or False'), ('essay', 'Essay'), ('enumeration', 'Enumeration'), ]
survey = models.ForeignKey(Survey, on_delete=models.CASCADE, related_name='questions') question_type = models.CharField(max_length=20, choices=QUESTION_TYPES) question_text = models.TextField() points = models.IntegerField(default=1) order = models.IntegerField(default=0) required = models.BooleanField(default=True) created_at = models.DateTimeField(auto_now_add=True) updated_at = models.DateTimeField(auto_now=True)
class Meta: ordering = ['order']
def __str__(self): return f"{self.survey.title} - Q{self.order}: {self.question_text[:50]}"
class MultipleChoiceOption(models.Model): """Options for multiple choice questions""" question = models.ForeignKey(Question, on_delete=models.CASCADE, related_name='options') option_text = models.CharField(max_length=255) is_correct = models.BooleanField(default=False) order = models.IntegerField(default=0)
class Meta: ordering = ['order']
def __str__(self): return self.option_text
class TrueFalseAnswer(models.Model): """Correct answer for true/false questions""" question = models.OneToOneField(Question, on_delete=models.CASCADE, related_name='true_false_answer') is_true = models.BooleanField()
def __str__(self): return "True" if self.is_true else "False"
class EnumerationAnswer(models.Model): """Correct answers for enumeration questions""" question = models.ForeignKey(Question, on_delete=models.CASCADE, related_name='enumeration_answers') answer_text = models.CharField(max_length=255) order = models.IntegerField(default=0)
class Meta: ordering = ['order']
def __str__(self): return self.answer_text
class StudentResponse(models.Model): """Student's response to a survey""" survey = models.ForeignKey(Survey, on_delete=models.CASCADE, related_name='responses') student = models.ForeignKey(User, on_delete=models.CASCADE, related_name='survey_responses') started_at = models.DateTimeField(auto_now_add=True) submitted_at = models.DateTimeField(null=True, blank=True) score = models.FloatField(null=True, blank=True) is_submitted = models.BooleanField(default=False)
class Meta: unique_together = ['survey', 'student']
def __str__(self): return f"{self.student.username} - {self.survey.title}"
class QuestionAnswer(models.Model): """Individual answer to a question""" response = models.ForeignKey(StudentResponse, on_delete=models.CASCADE, related_name='answers') question = models.ForeignKey(Question, on_delete=models.CASCADE)
# For multiple choice selected_option = models.ForeignKey(MultipleChoiceOption, null=True, blank=True, on_delete=models.SET_NULL)
# For true/false true_false_answer = models.BooleanField(null=True, blank=True)
# For essay and enumeration text_answer = models.TextField(blank=True)
# For scoring points_earned = models.FloatField(default=0) is_correct = models.BooleanField(null=True, blank=True)
created_at = models.DateTimeField(auto_now_add=True) updated_at = models.DateTimeField(auto_now=True)
def __str__(self): return f"{self.response.student.username} - Q{self.question.order}"
